adjective.description: Not even or balanced in shape or arrangement.
Contrary to the rules or to that which is normal or established.
examples: they were questioned about their involvement in irregular financial dealings

adjective.description: (of a verb or other word) having inflections that do not conform to the usual rules.

noun.description: A member of an irregular military force.
An imperfect piece of merchandise sold at a reduced price.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense not conforming to rule (especially that of the Church)): via Old French from medieval Latin irregularis, from in- not + regularis (see regular).
